alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 7:33PM EST until January 10 at 7:38AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Etowah River at Canton affecting Cherokee County. For the Etowah River Basin...including Canton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Etowah River at Canton. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands and fields along the river upstream and downstream from the gage by the Walaska Street bridge. Portions of recreational areas such as Boling Park behind the Cherokee County High School...the Cherokee County Fairgrounds and the Etowah River Greenway at Heritage Park will be flooded with up to one foot of water. The parking lot at Boling Park will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM EST Tuesday was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 3.8 feet early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 04/25/1908. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 745 AM EST.
